back_cards.definition_en: Used to specify a particular noun that is known to the context.
back_cards.example_en: The dog barked at the mailman every morning.

back_cards.definition_en: Indicates a unique or specific item.
back_cards.example_en: The sun sets slowly behind the mountain.

back_cards.definition_en: Refers to a general class or group.
back_cards.example_en: The tiger is a majestic animal in the wild.
She won the first prize in the competition.
He bought a car, and the car was blue.
I want to be happy in my new home.

back_cards.definition_en: To occupy a position or role.
back_cards.example_en: She will be the CEO of the company next year.

back_cards.definition_en: To describe a state or condition.
back_cards.example_en: The weather is cold today.
They are running in the park right now.
This book is my favorite novel.

back_cards.definition_en: Connects two similar ideas or items.
back_cards.example_en: I bought apples and oranges at the market.
She laughed and clapped during the show.
He finished his work and went home.

back_cards.definition_en: Links clauses to show cause or effect.
back_cards.example_en: It rained, and the streets were wet.
The room was cozy and inviting.
I saw a bird in the garden today.

back_cards.definition_en: Used before a noun to indicate one of many.
back_cards.example_en: She picked a flower from the bouquet.

back_cards.definition_en: Refers to something mentioned for the first time.
back_cards.example_en: He told me a story about his childhood.

back_cards.definition_en: Indicates membership in a class or group.
back_cards.example_en: He works as a teacher in the city.

back_cards.definition_en: Used in expressions of quantity or rate.
back_cards.example_en: The car costs a hundred dollars a day.
The book of poems belongs to her.
The city of Paris is beautiful at night.
A slice of cake was left on the table.
The necklace was made of silver.
He died of a heart attack last year.
She walked to the park this morning.
He studied hard to pass the exam.
I gave a gift to my friend.

back_cards.definition_en: Marks a point in time or extent.
back_cards.example_en: The store is open from nine to five.
The score was three to one.
The cat is sleeping in the box.
We met in July last year.
She is in love with her new job.
He works in the tech industry.
They spoke in a loud voice.

back_cards.definition_en: Refers to the speaker in a personal context.
back_cards.example_en: I went to the beach yesterday.
I think this movie is amazing.
I cooked dinner for my family.
I saw a deer in the forest.
I will start a new project tomorrow.

back_cards.definition_en: Addresses the person being spoken to.
back_cards.example_en: You look tired after the long day.
You need to drink water to stay healthy.
You should turn left at the corner.
You know how it feels to win.
You guys are invited to the party.

back_cards.definition_en: Refers to a specific object or thing.
back_cards.example_en: The book fell, and it broke.

back_cards.definition_en: Used to describe weather or time.
back_cards.example_en: It is raining outside right now.
It seems like a good idea.

back_cards.definition_en: Refers to an animal or creature.
back_cards.example_en: The dog wagged its tail.

back_cards.definition_en: Points to a situation or event.
back_cards.example_en: It was a fun party last night.
I have a new phone this year.
She had a great time at the concert.

back_cards.definition_en: To perform an action or task.
back_cards.example_en: They have lunch together every day.
You have to finish your homework.

back_cards.definition_en: To cause something to be done.
back_cards.example_en: He had his car repaired yesterday.
We drove to the mountains for vacation.
She works hard to save money.
He sent a letter to his sister.
The temperature dropped to zero.
This key is to the front door.

back_cards.definition_en: Points to a specific thing or person.
back_cards.example_en: That book on the shelf is mine.
The car that broke down was old.

back_cards.definition_en: Refers to a previously mentioned idea.
back_cards.example_en: He said he was tired, and that was true.

back_cards.definition_en: Used to express degree or extent.
back_cards.example_en: It wasn’t that hard to solve.
She studied so much that she passed.
I bought flowers for her birthday.
He waited for hours at the station.
This gift is for you.
She voted for the new policy.

back_cards.definition_en: Refers to a cause or motive.
back_cards.example_en: He was praised for his bravery.

back_cards.definition_en: To perform an action or task.
back_cards.example_en: I do my homework every evening.

back_cards.definition_en: To ask about activities or jobs.
back_cards.example_en: What do you do for a living?
I do love a good coffee.
She did the project on time.

back_cards.definition_en: To behave or act in a way.
back_cards.example_en: He does well in stressful situations.

back_cards.definition_en: Refers to a specific male person.
back_cards.example_en: He went to the store this morning.

back_cards.definition_en: Describes a male’s role or job.
back_cards.example_en: He is the manager of the team.
He fought bravely in the battle.
The dog barked, and he ran away.

back_cards.definition_en: Expresses a male’s opinion or action.
back_cards.example_en: He thinks the plan will work.
She went to the party with her friends.

back_cards.definition_en: Shows the means or tool used.
back_cards.example_en: He cut the paper with scissors.
The house with the red roof is old.
She spoke with confidence at the meeting.
He trembled with fear in the dark.
The book is on the table.

back_cards.definition_en: Refers to a specific day or time.
back_cards.example_en: We met on Monday last week.
She gave a talk on climate change.
He lives on a small pension.
The light is on in the room.

back_cards.definition_en: Points to a nearby or current thing.
back_cards.example_en: This chair is very comfortable.

back_cards.definition_en: Refers to the present time or situation.
back_cards.example_en: This year has been challenging.
This idea came up in the meeting.

back_cards.definition_en: Emphasizes a specific item or person.
back_cards.example_en: This man helped me find my way.

back_cards.definition_en: Used to describe a story or event.
back_cards.example_en: This happened during my vacation.

back_cards.definition_en: Contraction of 'not' used with 'be' to form negatives.
back_cards.example_en: I am not going to the party.
She isn’t happy with the results.
They aren’t here right now.
He isn’t the leader of the group.

back_cards.definition_en: Used in informal speech for negation.
back_cards.example_en: It isn’t cold outside today.
